summary: PR from mattleibow to update SkiaSharp from .NET 8 SDK (8.0.304) to .NET 10 SDK (10.0.103), restructuring the TFM system from Previous=net6.0/Current=net8.0 to Base=net6.0/Previous=net9.0/Current=net10.0, modernizing workload management via global.json workload sets instead of custom install-dotnet-workloads.ps1, removing the MAUI TPV workaround (dotnet/maui#24263), updating pipeline tool versions (Xcode 16.2, Emscripten 3.1.56), and adding a documentation checklist for future .NET version upgrades across 48 files.

versionAnalysis.relevanceReason: This PR targets the main branch and updates the entire build infrastructure for .NET 10. It will affect all future releases.

analysis.summary: Major build system modernization PR from the maintainer. Shifts the TFM chain forward two generations (net6→net8 becomes net6→net9→net10), replaces custom workload install scripts with built-in dotnet workload restore, removes a MAUI TPV workaround that's fixed upstream, updates CI pipeline tool versions, and fixes a latent bug where PlatformTargetFrameworksPrevious was referenced but never defined. Also adds a new documentation/updating-dotnet-version.md checklist to streamline future upgrades.
analysis.rationale: This is clearly an enhancement (not a bug fix or feature request) — it improves the existing build system rather than adding user-facing functionality. It's area/Build since all 48 changed files are build props, pipeline YAML, csproj TFM updates, and workload scripts. The tenet/compatibility label applies because TFM changes directly affect which .NET versions consumers can target. It directly addresses .NET 10 support gaps reported in #3422 (Blazor WASM) and #3428 (MAUI iOS).

keySignals.text: Pin SDK to 10.0.103 with workload sets (workloadVersion)
keySignals.interpretation: Moves from custom workload install scripts to the modern global.json workload pinning approach introduced in .NET 8+.

keySignals.text: TFMBase=net6.0, TFMPrevious=net9.0, TFMCurrent=net10.0, Removed TFMNext entirely
keySignals.interpretation: Restructures from 2-tier (Previous+Current) to 3-tier (Base+Previous+Current) TFM system, dropping the preview TFMNext slot.

keySignals.text: Remove MAUI TPV workaround (dotnet/maui#24263 fixed in .NET 9+)
keySignals.interpretation: Lines 132-139 and 159-166 in SkiaSharp.Build.props clear and restore TPV values — this workaround can be removed since the fix shipped in .NET 9.

keySignals.text: Add full PlatformTargetFrameworksPrevious block (was referenced but never defined)
keySignals.interpretation: Line 114 of SkiaSharp.Build.props references $(PlatformTargetFrameworksPrevious) but no PropertyGroup defines it — a latent bug that was harmless because Previous=net6.0 had no platform TFMs, but becomes critical when Previous=net9.0.

keySignals.text: Replace install-dotnet-workloads.ps1 with dotnet workload restore
keySignals.interpretation: Eliminates 50+ lines of custom PowerShell that manually managed NuGet feeds and workload lists in favor of the SDK's built-in mechanism.
Pipeline tool versions updated to match .NET 10 era requirements.

codeInvestigation.finding: Current TFM definitions: TFMPrevious=net6.0, TFMCurrent=net8.0, TFMNext=empty. The PR restructures this to Base=net6.0, Previous=net9.0, Current=net10.0.

PlatformTargetFrameworks references $(PlatformTargetFrameworksPrevious) but it is never defined — confirmed latent bug. Currently harmless because net6.0 has no platform TFMs, but would break when Previous becomes net9.0 with platform support.
MAUI TPV workaround: lines 132-139 clear TPV values, lines 159-166 restore them. This works around dotnet/maui#24263 which shipped a fix in .NET 9, making this workaround removable.
SDK pinned to 8.0.100 with rollForward:latestMinor, no workload settings. PR adds workloadVersion for modern workload set management.
DOTNET_VERSION=8.0.304, XCODE_VERSION=15.4, EMSCRIPTEN_VERSION=3.1.34, DOTNET_VERSION_PREVIEW=empty. All need updating for .NET 10.
Custom workload management with manual NuGet feed configuration and per-platform workload lists. PR replaces this with dotnet workload restore.
Hardcoded net8.0-android, net8.0-ios, net8.0-maccatalyst TFMs in Cake build scripts — these will need updating to net10.0.
NativeAssets csproj uses $(TFMCurrent)-android$(TPVAndroidCurrent) with conditional TFMNext. PR changes 14 such files to use TFMPrevious;TFMCurrent pattern.

resolution.hypothesis: The PR implements a well-structured .NET SDK version bump with proper TFM chain management. The key design decision is the 3-tier Base/Previous/Current system which maintains backward compatibility while dropping the preview slot.
